represents.label: Energy
represents.description: Boosts physical energy levels, increases heart rate and blood pressure, prompts adrenaline release

represents.label: Action
represents.description: Fast moving, promotes need for action and movement

represents.label: Desire
represents.description: Relates to physical desire in all its forms - sexual, appetite, cravings

represents.label: Passion
represents.description: Passionate belief in an issue or undertaking, including love or hate; anger is negative passion

effects.label: Stimulating
effects.description: Stimulates physical senses, sexual and physical appetite; triggers deeper passions such as sex, love, courage, hatred, revenge

effects.label: Exciting And Motivating
effects.description: Excites emotions and inspires action

effects.label: Attention Getting
effects.description: Demands notice, alerts to danger (e.g., red traffic lights and stop signs)

effects.label: Assertive And Aggressive
effects.description: Associated with assertiveness and aggression (e.g., drivers of red cars feeling aggressive)

represents.label: Adventure & Risk-Taking
represents.description: Promotes physical confidence and enthusiasm; Favored by sportsmen and adventure seekers

represents.label: Social Communication & Interaction
represents.description: Stimulates two-way conversation between people; Ideal for social gatherings and dining rooms

represents.label: Friendship
represents.description: Associated with group socialising and parties; Represents community and togetherness

represents.label: Divorce
represents.description: Symbolises optimism helping people move forward; Encourages forward and outward thinking

effects.label: Enthusiasm
effects.description: Optimistic and extroverted energy; Represents the uninhibited

effects.label: Rejuvenation
effects.description: Helps restore balance to physical energies; Revitalises and refreshes the spirit

effects.label: Stimulation
effects.description: Stimulates appetite and general energy; Less intense and passionate than red

effects.label: Courage
effects.description: Encourages facing consequences and change; Motivates onward and upward movement

effects.label: Vitality
effects.description: Has balanced and lively energy; Less aggressive than red but full of life

represents.label: Mind and intellect
represents.description: Yellow stimulates mental activity and activates the analytical brain

represents.label: Happiness and fun
represents.description: Uplifts the spirit and encourages confidence and enthusiasm for life

represents.label: Communication of new ideas
represents.description: Relates to the expression and integration of thoughts and innovations

effects.label: Creative
effects.description: Supports the birth of new ideas and innovative thinking

effects.label: Quick decisions
effects.description: Encourages clear thinking and fast choices but may lead to impulsivity

effects.label: Anxiety producing
effects.description: Its fast vibration can increase agitation and emotional instability

effects.label: Critical
effects.description: Sharpens the analytical mind but can cause judgmental attitudes

effects.label: Non-emotional
effects.description: Associated more with intellectual processing than emotional depth

represents.label: Harmony and balance
represents.description: Green balances mental, emotional and physical energies — it's the heart center of the body.

represents.label: Growth
represents.description: In nature, green signifies active life and continuous development.

represents.label: Hope
represents.description: It embodies optimism and the anticipation of positive outcomes.

effects.label: Rejuvenating
effects.description: Green revitalises us when we're physically, mentally, or emotionally tired.

effects.label: Nurturing
effects.description: Encourages nurturing of both others and oneself, thanks to its heart-centered energy.

effects.label: Diplomatic
effects.description: Fosters clear thinking and understanding from all perspectives.

effects.label: Possessiveness
effects.description: Can create the urge to possess people or things, fostering materialism.

effects.label: Envy
effects.description: Negatively associated with jealousy — 'green with envy.'

represents.label: Communication
represents.description: Blue relates to one-to-one verbal communication and self expression.

represents.label: Peace and Calm
represents.description: Induces calm and peace within us, especially the deeper shades.

represents.label: Honesty
represents.description: Blue is the colour of truth and sincerity.

represents.label: Authority
represents.description: The darker the blue, the greater its sense of authority and confidence.

represents.label: Religion
represents.description: Blue is linked to devotion and spiritual reflection.

represents.label: Wisdom
represents.description: Enhances intellectual insight and thoughtful reflection.

effects.label: Conservative
effects.description: Blue is the safest and most universally liked colour.

effects.label: Predictable
effects.description: Blue avoids impulsiveness and prefers planning and analysis.

effects.label: Orderly
effects.description: Blue values structure, direction, and organisation.

effects.label: Rigid
effects.description: Prefers familiarity and can resist change, even when it’s beneficial.

represents.label: Intuition
represents.description: Use it to assist in accessing intuitive abilities — it is the first step to higher spiritual knowledge.

represents.label: Integrity
represents.description: Indigo symbolises deep sincerity and integrity.

represents.label: Structure and Order
represents.description: A good colour to use in restructuring aspects of your life or business.

represents.label: Wisdom
represents.description: Represents an inner knowingness — spiritual wisdom beyond intellectual understanding.

effects.label: Introspection
effects.description: Promotes deep concentration during introspection and meditation, though it may lead to feeling 'spaced out'.

effects.label: Idealistic
effects.description: Fosters an ability to plan for the future with vision and clarity.

effects.label: Addiction
effects.description: Can support addictive tendencies and should be avoided when trying to break harmful habits. Associated with fanaticism and workaholism.

effects.label: The Dramatist
effects.description: Linked to theatricality and exaggeration — making mountains out of molehills.

effects.label: Conformity
effects.description: Encourages adherence to rituals and traditional structures, often tied to the past.

represents.label: Inspiration
represents.description: Original and sound ideas are created with violet - use it when looking for inspiration during brainstorming sessions.

represents.label: Imagination
represents.description: Violet inspires creativity with intellect and stimulates dream activity.

represents.label: Individuality
represents.description: Violet is unconventional, individual and original. It hates to copy anyone else and likes to do its own thing.

represents.label: Spirituality
represents.description: Violet assists us during prayer and meditation, helping us to get in touch with our deeper subconscious thoughts.

effects.label: Empathy
effects.description: Compassion, kindness and a love of humanity are positive qualities of Violet.

effects.label: Controlled Emotion
effects.description: Violet is passionate, like red, but inclined to display it in private only.

effects.label: Respectable & Distinguished
effects.description: The darker shades of violet are linked to royalty and wealth.

effects.label: Impractical
effects.description: Violet can be impractical, tending to see life as imagined rather than reality.

effects.label: Immature
effects.description: Violet can encourage fantasy and idealism that are hard to achieve.

effects.label: Dignity
effects.description: Violet exudes a quiet modest dignity appealing to others.

effects.label: Cynical
effects.description: Violet can show a negative cynical side.

represents.label: Communication
represents.description: Turquoise represents open communication from and between the heart and the spoken word. It relates to the electronic age, the world of computers, and large-scale communication.

represents.label: Emotional Control
represents.description: Being the mid-colour between the extremes of red and violet, turquoise symbolises balance for emotions, thoughts, and speech.

represents.label: Self-Sufficiency
represents.description: Turquoise tunes into its own needs and finds the way to success.

effects.label: Clarity of Thought
effects.description: Enhances focus and concentration, assists with clear thinking, decision-making, and developing good organisational skills.

effects.label: Calming
effects.description: Calming yet invigorating, restores depleted energies.

effects.label: Non-Emotional
effects.description: Can cause aloofness and hiding of emotional reactions.

represents.label: Unconditional Love
represents.description: Pink relates to both unconditional love and romantic love.

represents.label: Compassion
represents.description: Empathy and understanding are the fuel for pink's nurturing.

represents.label: Nurturing
represents.description: Pink is both the giving and the receiving of love, understanding and respect.

represents.label: Hope
represents.description: Pink inspires the possibility of a positive outcome.

effects.label: Calming
effects.description: Pink calms our emotional energies.

effects.label: Non-Threatening
effects.description: Pink lacks any aggression or anger, although the deeper pinks can be more assertive and confident.

effects.label: Affectionate
effects.description: Pink offers warmth and tenderness to friends and family.

effects.label: Caring
effects.description: Sensitivity and tender loving care relate to pink's feminine and intuitive energies.

effects.label: Immature
effects.description: Pink is the colour of the sweet young girl, before life's experiences take over.

represents.label: Universal Harmony
represents.description: At its highest level, magenta generates love, caring, kindness and cooperation, encouraging a balanced and harmonious outlook on life.

represents.label: Non-Conformist
represents.description: Magenta is the colour of the free spirit—it does not like to be confined and contained.

represents.label: Change and Transformation
represents.description: Magenta helps to release old and outdated patterns of behavior to inspire growth and personal development.

effects.label: Emotional Balance
effects.description: Spiritual yet practical, it helps to create emotional, physical and spiritual balance.

effects.label: Compassion
effects.description: Gentle and caring in its approach, magenta generates acceptance, tolerance, support and patience.

effects.label: Inspiration
effects.description: Magenta inspires cheerfulness and optimism, creativity and innovation, dream activity, positive change and negotiating skills.

represents.label: Stability
represents.description: Reassuring and comforting, earthy and contained.

represents.label: Structure
represents.description: It encourages orderliness and organisation.

represents.label: Security
represents.description: Safe and protective — a refuge from the chaos of the outside world and a sense of belonging.

represents.label: Natural and Wholesome
represents.description: Related to the earth, nutrition, health and goodness.

effects.label: Comforting
effects.description: Sensual and warm, friendly and approachable, brown engulfs one in a feeling of calm and safety.

effects.label: Protective
effects.description: Creates a safe haven of support for family and friends.

effects.label: Materialistic
effects.description: Brown encourages material security and the accumulation of possessions.

represents.label: Neutrality
represents.description: Gray is impartial and dispassionate; it doesn't take sides.

represents.label: Compromise
represents.description: Gray is the transition between two non-colours, neither black nor white. It takes the middle ground, neither one way nor the other.

represents.label: Control
represents.description: Gray is reserved, quiet and conservative. It has a steadying effect on other colours around it.

effects.label: Indecision
effects.description: Gray prefers to sit in the middle, not making a decision either way, sitting on the fence.

effects.label: Detached
effects.description: Being non-emotional, gray can appear indifferent, uncaring, cold and aloof.

effects.label: Depression
effects.description: Gray can stifle and depress energy, but it is also the stable base from which the new and positive can come.

effects.label: Unemotional
effects.description: Gray can appear neutral, disinterested, objective or impartial.

represents.label: Mystery
represents.description: Black is the unknown. It is secretive, keeping a lot buried inside, unwilling to show its real feelings.

represents.label: Power and Control
represents.description: Black is power and control of the self and others. It creates fear and intimidation.

effects.label: Formal, Dignified and Sophisticated
effects.description: As in the little black dress and the formal dinner suit, black represents elegance and refinement.

effects.label: Aloof
effects.description: Black sets itself aside from others with its heavy and intense energy. It keeps others at arm's length.

effects.label: Depressing
effects.description: Black can close us to the positive aspects of life, forcing us to look at our disappointments and the negative aspects of life. It can create a fear of the future.

effects.label: Pessimistic
effects.description: Too much black encourages us to focus on the negative side of life.

represents.label: Innocence and Purity
represents.description: White is the beginning of everything, before anything is muddied or thinking is 'coloured'.

represents.label: New Beginnings
represents.description: White represents the clean slate, helping us through times of stress, and allowing us to put the past behind us and prepare to move on.

represents.label: Equality and Unity
represents.description: White represents the positive as well as the negative aspects of all colours. It contains an equal balance of all the colours of the spectrum.

effects.label: Impartial
effects.description: White suggests fairness and neutrality because of the balance and equality of all the colours contained within it.

effects.label: Rescuer
effects.description: White rescues us from the dark. It is the white knight, rescuing the damsel in distress.

effects.label: Futuristic
effects.description: Symbolising a clean slate, we can envisage anything with white.

effects.label: Efficient
effects.description: White is clean and clinical, giving an impression of efficiency and organisation.

represents.label: Illumination
represents.description: Silver opens the mind and lights the way forward.

represents.label: Reflection
represents.description: It reflects back the energy sent out, whether that energy is positive or negative.

represents.label: Prestige and Wealth
represents.description: Silver is seen as glamorous and sophisticated, and relates to the professional and corporate market.

represents.label: Feminine Power
represents.description: Silver is related to the femininity of the moon's energy, sensitive, emotional and fluid.

effects.label: Calming and Soothing
effects.description: Its gentle and comforting qualities relate to the sensitivity of the moon's cycle of ebb and flow.

effects.label: Lifeless
effects.description: The colourless energy of silver can lead to negative feelings of coldness, indecision and being non-committal.

effects.label: Dignified and Responsible
effects.description: Silver is respectable and courteous, mature and determined, wise and organised.

represents.label: Success
represents.description: Gold relates to achievement and victory, the winner.

represents.label: Wealth
represents.description: Gold implies affluence, material wealth and extravagance.

represents.label: Prestige & Luxury
represents.description: Gold is associated with sophistication, elegance, value, quality and status.

effects.label: Enlightenment
effects.description: Gold, at its highest level, inspires knowledge, spirituality and a deep understanding of the self and the soul.

effects.label: Compassion
effects.description: Caring, loving, generous and giving, gold is the benefactor or patron.

effects.label: Generosity
effects.description: Gold loves to share its wisdom, knowledge and wealth with others.
